newsitem.title: KENYA: Kenya coffee prices strong at weekly auction.
newsitem.headline: Kenya coffee prices strong at weekly auction.

text.p: Kenyan coffee prices were strong at the weekly auction in Nairobi as traders scrambled to catch the last traces of good quality coffee, auction officials said on Tuesday.
"The good quality coffee is expected to end in June and a lot of traders also rushed into the market to cover their contractual obligations," one trader said.
Grade ABs averaged $365 per 50-kg (110 lb) compared to $350 last week, while grade AAs averaged $382 from $351.
The Coffee Board of Kenya said it sold 35,341 60-kg bags of coffee compared to 35,697 bags sold last week.
